intro: Corydalis micrantha var. texensis, commonly known as the Texas dwarf corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers throughout the spring. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in native plant gardens.
